verses.verse: Wine <S%H3196><s%> is a mocker, <S%H3887><s%> and beer <S%H7941><s%> is a brawler. <S%H1993><s%> Whoever is led astray <S%H7686><s%> by them is not wise. <S%H2449><s%>

The terror <S%H367><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%> is like the roaring <S%H5099><s%> of a lion. <S%H3715><s%> He who provokes him to anger <S%H5674><s%> forfeits <S%H2398><s%> his own life. <S%H5315><s%>
It is an honor <S%H3519><s%> for a man <S%H376><s%> to keep aloof from strife; <S%H7379><s%> but every fool <S%H191><s%> will be quarreling. <S%H1566><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> will not plow <S%H2790><s%> by reason of the winter; <S%H2779><s%> therefore he shall beg <S%H7592><s%> in harvest, <S%H7105><s%> and have nothing.

Counsel <S%H6098><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> is like deep <S%H6013><s%> water; <S%H4325><s%> but a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> will draw it out. <S%H1802><s%>
Many <S%H7230><s%> men <S%H120><s%> claim <S%H7121><s%> to be men <S%H376><s%> of unfailing love, <S%H2617><s%> but who can find <S%H4672><s%> a faithful <S%H529><s%> man? <S%H376><s%>
A righteous <S%H6662><s%> man walks <S%H1980><s%> in integrity. <S%H8537><s%> Blessed <S%H835><s%> are his children <S%H1121><s%> after him. <S%H310><s%>
A king <S%H4428><s%> who sits on <S%H3427><s%> the throne <S%H3678><s%> of judgment <S%H1779><s%> scatters away <S%H2219><s%> all evil <S%H7451><s%> with his eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
Who can say, <S%H559><s%> "I have made my heart <S%H3820><s%> pure. <S%H2891><s%> I am clean <S%H2135><s%> and without sin? <S%H2403><s%>"
Differing weights <S%H68><s%> and differing measures, <S%H374><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them alike <S%H1571><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>
Even a child <S%H5288><s%> makes himself known <S%H5234><s%> by his doings, <S%H4611><s%> whether his work <S%H6467><s%> is pure, <S%H2134><s%> and whether it is right. <S%H3477><s%>
The hearing <S%H8085><s%> ear, <S%H241><s%> and the seeing <S%H7200><s%> eye, <S%H5869><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> even both of them. <S%H8147><s%>
Don't <S%H157><s%> love sleep, <S%H8142><s%> lest you come to poverty. <S%H3423><s%> Open <S%H6491><s%> your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and you shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with bread. <S%H3899><s%>
"It <S%H7451><s%>'s no good, it <S%H7451><s%>'s no good," says <S%H559><s%> the buyer; <S%H7069><s%> but when he is gone <S%H235><s%> his way, <S%H1984><s%> then he boasts.
There is <S%H3426><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%> and abundance <S%H7230><s%> of rubies; <S%H6443><s%> but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%> are a rare <S%H3366><s%> jewel. <S%H3627><s%>
Take <S%H3947><s%> the garment <S%H899><s%> of one who puts up collateral <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger; <S%H2114><s%> and hold him in pledge <S%H2254><s%> for a wayward woman. <S%H5237><s%>
Fraudulent <S%H8267><s%> food <S%H3899><s%> is sweet <S%H6156><s%> to a man, <S%H376><s%> but afterwards <S%H310><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> is filled <S%H4390><s%> with gravel. <S%H2687><s%>
Plans <S%H4284><s%> are established <S%H3559><s%> by advice; <S%H8458><s%> by wise guidance <S%H8458><s%> you wage <S%H6213><s%> war! <S%H4421><s%>

He who goes about <S%H1980><s%> as a tale-bearer <S%H7400><s%> reveals <S%H1540><s%> secrets; <S%H5475><s%> therefore don't <S%H6148><s%> keep company with him who opens <S%H6601><s%> wide his lips. <S%H8193><s%>
Whoever curses <S%H7043><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother, <S%H517><s%> his lamp <S%H5216><s%> shall be put out <S%H1846><s%> in blackness <S%H380><s%> of darkness. <S%H2822><s%>
An inheritance <S%H5159><s%> quickly gained <S%H926><s%> at the beginning, <S%H7223><s%> won't <S%H1288><s%> be blessed in the end. <S%H319><s%>
Don't <S%H559><s%> say, "I will pay <S%H7999><s%> back evil. <S%H7451><s%>" Wait for <S%H6960><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and he will save you. <S%H3467><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> detests <S%H8441><s%> differing weights, <S%H68><s%> and dishonest <S%H4820><s%> scales <S%H3976><s%> are not pleasing. <S%H2896><s%>
A man <S%H1397><s%>'s steps <S%H4703><s%> are from Yahweh; <S%H3068><s%> how then can man <S%H120><s%> understand <S%H995><s%> his way? <S%H1870><s%>
It is a snare <S%H4170><s%> to a man <S%H120><s%> to make a rash <S%H3216><s%> dedication, <S%H6944><s%> then later <S%H310><s%> to consider <S%H1239><s%> his vows. <S%H5088><s%>
A wise <S%H2450><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> winnows <S%H2219><s%> out the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and drives <S%H7725><s%> the threshing wheel over them. <S%H212><s%>
The spirit <S%H5397><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is Yahweh <S%H3068><s%>'s lamp, <S%H5216><s%> searching <S%H2664><s%> all his innermost <S%H2315><s%> parts. <S%H2315><s%>
Love <S%H2617><s%> and faithfulness <S%H571><s%> keep <S%H5341><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> safe. <S%H3678><s%> His throne is sustained <S%H5582><s%> by love. <S%H2617><s%>
The glory <S%H8597><s%> of young men <S%H970><s%> is their strength. <S%H3581><s%> The splendor <S%H1926><s%> of old men <S%H2205><s%> is their gray hair. <S%H7872><s%>
Wounding <S%H6482><s%> blows <S%H2250><s%> cleanse <S%H8562><s%> away evil, <S%H7451><s%> and beatings <S%H4347><s%> purge the innermost <S%H2315><s%> parts. <S%H2315><s%>
